Name: T1L1 Brand Management
Documentation: Ability to establish, organize, analyze, administer, and report on all aspects of a name, symbol, or design that identifies and differentiates products, offerings, or organizational identities.

Name: T1L1 Business Entity Management
Documentation: Ability to create, structure, and govern the legal body or bodies that comprises or comprise a single organization.

Name: T1L2 Brand Awareness Determination
Documentation: Ability to assess and quantify the degree of familiarity and recognition a brand has within and across various markets.

Name: T1L2 Brand Definition
Documentation: Ability to articulate, establish, and create the brand in a manner which demonstrates to customers what it does, what it stands for and why it is different from its competitors.

Name: T1L2 Brand Information Management
Documentation: Ability to collect, organize, monitor, report on, or otherwise disseminate basic facts, statistics, attributes, and data about the brand.

Name: T1l2 Brand Loyalty Determination
Documentation: Ability to assess and quantify the commitment and staying power that the brand has within the markets in which it has a presence.

Name: T1L2 Brand Matching
Documentation: Ability to associate a brand with other relevant aspects of the organization that are impacted by, affected, or otherwise concerned with a brand.

Name: T1L2 Brand Performance Management
Documentation: Ability to determine how well a brand is meeting objectives or delivering against plan.

Name: T1L2 Brand Targeting
Documentation: Ability to identify and specify the stakeholders, markets, locations, and industry sectors marked for building brand awareness.

Name: L1 Asset Management
Documentation: Handles the forecasting and evaluation of financial risks and the identification of needed remediation efforts to reduce impact to the organization.

Name: L1 Bank Segments
Documentation: Encompasses the various areas in which customers can interact with a Financial Service Organization

Name: L1 Corporate Functions
Documentation: Handles the various areas necessary in a corporate structure.

Name: L1 Information Technology
Documentation: Handles the management of systems (via computers and telecommunications) for storing, retrieving, and sending information.

Name: L1 Risk Management
Documentation: Handles the forecasting and evaluation of financial risks and the identification of needed remediation efforts to reduce impact to the organization.

Name: L1 Security
Documentation: Ensures that an organization has taken precautions against danger or threat.

Name: L2 Asset and Liability Management
Documentation: Handles managing the use of assets and cash flows to meet company obligations, which reduces the organization's risk of loss due to not paying a liability on time.

Name: L2 Audit
Documentation: Conducts reviews to ensure that compliance criteria are met by the organization.

Name: L2 Business Continuity
Documentation: Handles planning and preparation to ensure an organization can continue to operate in the event of a seriiuos incident or disaster, ensuring the ability to recover to an operational state within a reasonably short period.

Name: L2 Capital Markets
Documentation: Supports the raising of capital regarding shares, bonds, and other long-term investments

Name: L2 Commercial / Wholesale Banking
Documentation: Handles the administering of products and services to commercial clients, businesses, and business owners.

Name: L2 Compliance
Documentation: Handles ensuring that all applicable laws, regulations, and rules are adhered to by the organization.

Name: L2 Corporate Communications
Documentation: Supports the management and orchestration of all internal and external communications for an organization.

Name: L2 Corporate Insurance
Documentation: Ensures that an organization is protected against risk and exposure.

Name: L2 Cyber Security
Documentation: Manages the measures to pretect networks, computers, programs, and data from attack, damage, or unauthorized access.

Name: L2 Enterprise Portfolio Management
Documentation: Supports the objectives regarding investment mix and policy, including balancing risk against performance at an enterprise level.

Name: L2 Enterprise Risk Management
Documentation: Handles planning, organization, leading, and controlling the activities of an organization in order to minimize the effects of risk on the organization's capital and earnings. ERM is the aggregate of operational, credit, market, and liquidity risk insights.

Name: L2 Finance
Documentation: Handles the management of financial affairs for an organization.

Name: L2 Fraud Management
Documentation: Manages the prevention, detection, and alert / case management activities associated with potential and existing fraud instances.

Name: L2 Human Resources
Documentation: Manages the personnel of the organization, including the hiring, administration, and training of personnel.

Name: L2 Information Security
Documentation: Manages the protection against unauthorized use of information.

Name: L2 Legal
Documentation: Provides legal services for the organization by addressing legal risk and providing advice and counsel.

Name: L2 Marketing
Documentation: Handles the promotion and selling of products or services, including market research and advertising.

Name: L2 Mergers and Acquisitions
Documentation: Supports corporate finance and management dealing with the buying, selling, dividing, and combining of different companies and similar entities that can help an organization grow rapidly in its sector or location or origin, or a new field or new location, without creating a subsidiary, other child entity, or using a joint venture.

Name: L2 Physical Security
Documentation: Manages the protection of people, property, and physical assets from actions and events that could cause damage or loss.

Name: L2 Realty Services
Documentation: Handles the management of the owned or leased real estate portfolio of the organization.

Name: L2 Retail / Personal Banking
Documentation: Handles the administering of products and services to individual consumers.

Name: L2 Security Surveillance
Documentation: Manages the monitoring of behavior, activities, and information for the purpose of information gathering, influencing, managing, or directing.

Name: L2 Shared Services
Documentation: Handles the provision of services to more than one part of the organization, effectively becoming an internal service provider.

Name: L2 Supply Chain Management
Documentation: Handles the management of materials, information, and finances as they move from supplier to consumer.

Name: L2 Technology and Innovation Services
Documentation: Supports the process of introducing new ideas, devices, or methods.

Name: L2 Technology and Operations Services
Documentation: Handles the processes and services that are both provisioned by an IT staff to their internal or external clients and used by themselves to run themselves as a business.

Name: L2 Technology Services
Documentation: Supports the use of specialized technology-oriented solutions by combining process and functions of software, hardware, networks, telecommunications, and electronics.

Name: L2 Treasury Management
Documentation: Handles the management of an organization's holdings with the goal of managing liquidity and mitigating risk.

Name: L2 Wealth Management
Documentation: Handles the administering of products and services to individual consumers pertaining to financial and investment advice, retirement planning, and legal and estate planning.

Name: L3 Accounts Payable
Documentation: Handles a current liability account in which an organizationrecords the amount it owes to suppliers or vendors for goods or services that is received on credit.

Name: L3 Accounts Receivable
Documentation: Handles a current asset account in which an organization records teh amounts it has a right to collect from customers who received goods or services on credit.

Name: L3 Asset and Liability Management
Documentation: Handles the process of managing the use of assets and cash flows to reduce the firm's risk of loss from not paying a liability on time.

Name: L3 Asset Management
Documentation: Handles the monitoring of portfolio financial performance and planning for future dispositions and capital improvements.

Name: L3 Audit Quality Assurance
Documentation: Manages the process of systematic examination of a quality system to ensure the organization complies with the defined quality system processes and can involve procedural or results-based assessment criteria.

Name: L3 Benefits Administration
Documentation: Handles the prcess of creating, managing, and updating an organization's employee benefits program, including new employee enrollment and ensuring all employees understand available plans.

Name: L3 Business Development
Documentation: Handles the activity of pursuing strategic opportunities for an organization, including cultivating partnerships or other commercial relationships, or identifying new markets for its products or services.

Name: L3 Cash and Liquidity Management
Documentation: Handles ongoing strategies and processes to ensure that an organization is able to access cash as needed to pay for goods and services, make payroll, and invest in new opportunities that arise.

Name: L3 Compliance and Performance Audit
Documentation: Manages the effectiveness of the organization's processes and ensures an organizatio is complying to the minimum regulatory requirements.

Name: L3 Construction Management
Documentation: Handles the oversight of rehabilitation and construction projects as well as General Contractor services on small rehabilitation jobs.

Name: L3 Credit Office
Documentation: Handles the decisioning of credit product offerings to an organization's client.

Name: L3 Credit Office
Documentation: Handles the decisioning of credit product offerings to an organization's client.

Name: L3 Credit Office
Documentation: Handles the decisioning of credit product offerings to an organization's client.

Name: L3 Crisis Management
Documentation: Handels the key communication mechanisms necessary to ensure employee safety, provide initial information and direction, and organize ongoing actions. They are responsible for testing and execution to ensure continuity.

Name: L3 Cyber Defense
Documentation: Manages the ability to thwart cyber attacks through cyber security, involving all processes and practices that will defend a network, its data, and nodes from unauthorized access or manipulation.

Name: L3 Cyber Operations
Documentation: Manages the passive and active efforts intended to preserve the ability to utilize cyberspace capabilities and protect data, networks, net-centric capabilities, and other designated systems.

Name: L3 Cyber Technologies Research
Documentation: Manages the investigation of existing types of malware, analyzing their capabilities,and attempting to predict new forms of malware to develop appropriate security responses.

Name: L3 Defense Litigation
Documentation: Manages the process of resolving disputes by filing or answering a compliant through the public court system.

Name: L3 Derivative Markets Services
Documentation: Supports the financial market for financial instruments which are derived from other forms of assets.

Name: L3 Disaster Recovery
Documentation: Handles the plans in place to restore essential information technology (IT) systems and applications that enable critical business processes.

Name: L3 Employee Relations
Documentation: Handles an organization's efforts to create and maintain a positive relationship with its employees.

Name: L3 Enterprise Architecture
Documentation: Handles comprehensive enterprise analysis, design, planning, and implementation for the successful development and execution of an organization's strategy.

Name: L3 Facilities Management
Documentation: Handles the rent collection, payment or operating expenses, and management of maintenance for an organization's physical locations.

Name: L3 Financial Accounting
Documentation: Handles the process or recording, summarizing, and reporting the transaction resulting from business operations over a period in time.

Name: L3 Financial Compliance
Documentation: Handles the adherence to laws, regulations, guidelines and specifications related to an organization's financial standing to protect investors / consumer and maintain consumer confidence int he financial system.

Name: L3 Financial Institution Services
Documentation: Supports the economic services provided by the organization.

Name: L3 Financial Structuring
Documentation: Handles the structure of capital stacks for larger development projects.

Name: L3 Financial Tax
Documentation: Manages the taxes paid by an organization based on its profit.

Name: L3 Fixed Income Services
Documentation: Supports the investment under which the issuer is obliged to make payments of a fixed amount on a fixed schedule (includes bonds).

Name: L3 Foreign Exchange Services
Documentation: Supports the exchange of one currency for another where currencies are traded around the clock.

Name: L3 Forensic Investigations
Documentation: Manages the examination and evaluation of an organization's or individual's financial records to derive evidence that can be used in a court of law or legal proceeding.

Name: L3 Fraud Investigation
Documentation: Manages the alert and examination of potential fraud activities associated within potential and existing fraud instances.

Name: L3 Fraud Monitoring
Documentation: Manages the screening of transaction activities across users, agreements, financial accounts, processes and channels to identify and prevent internal and external fraud within an organization.

Name: L3 Fraud Prevention
Documentation: Manages the screening of account opening activities across users, agreements, financial accounts, processes and channels to identify and prevent internal and external fraud within an organization. They are responsible for testing and execution to ensure continuity.

Name: L3 General Counsel
Documentation: Provide legal advice and guidance on matters of law, including reviewing and drafting legal documents, managing risk, conducting negotiations on behalf of the organization, and ensuring the organization's legal compliance.

Name: L3 Human Resources Information Management
Documentation: Handles the information to aid in effectively managing people, data, and human resources processing for employees and contractors.

Name: L3 Human Resources Risk Management
Documentation: Handles the processes associated with regulatory compliance and reporting obligations related to human resources.

Name: L3 Incident Response
Documentation: Manages the after math of a security breach or cyberattack, also known as an IT incident, computer incident, or security incident.

Name: L3 Information Technology Audit
Documentation: Manages the examination and evaluation of an organization's information technology infrastructure, application, data use, and management, policies, procedures, and operational processes against recognized standards or established policies.

Name: L3 Internal Communications
Documentation: Handles and promotes effective communications among internal participants within an organization.

Name: L3 Logistics
Documentation: Plans, implements, and controls the efficient, effective forward and reverses flow and storage of goods, services and related information between the point of origin and the point of consumption in order to meet customers' requirements.

Name: L3 M&A Analysis
Documentation: Handles the analysis representing the combination of two organizations that come together through an M&A process.

Name: L3 M&A Planning
Documentation: Supports and outlines exactly how and when major resources, assets, and processes of the acquiring and acquired organizations will be combined in order to achieve the goals of the deal.

Name: L3 Marketing Communications
Documentation: Handles the channels that focus on any way a business communicates a message to its desired market, or the market in general.

Name: L3 Media Relations
Documentation: Handles working with media for the purpose of informing the public of an organization's mission, policies and practices in a positive, consistent and credible manner.

Name: L3 Offensive Engineering
Documentation: Manages the proactive and adversarial approach to protecting computer systems, networks, and individuals from security attacks.

Name: L3 Payroll
Documentation: Handles the process of calculating and distributing wages and taxes for employees.

Name: L3 Portfolio Management
Documentation: Supports the objectives regarding investment mix and policy, including balancing risk against performance.

Name: L3 Portfolio Management
Documentation: Supports the objectives regarding investment mix and policy, including balancing risk against performance.

Name: L3 Portfolio Management
Documentation: Supports the objectives regarding investment mix and policy, including balancing risk against performance.

Name: L3 Process Improvement
Documentation: Handles the business practice of identifying, analyzing, and improving existing business processes to optimize performance, meet best practice standards, or improve quality and the user experience for customers and end-users.

Name: L3 Procurement
Documentation: Handles the process of acquiring the goods an organization requires.

Name: L3 Product Office
Documentation: Handles the development and enhancement of the channel's product offerings.

Name: L3 Product Office
Documentation: Handles the development and enhancement of the channel's product offerings.

Name: L3 Product Office
Documentation: Handles the development and enhancement of the channel's product offerings.

Name: L3 Program Management
Documentation: Handles the process of managing several related projects for an organization from inception through implementation.

Name: L3 Project and Portfolio Management
Documentation: Handles the process of leading the work of a team to achieve goals and meet success criteria within specific time constraints.

Name: L3 Public Affairs
Documentation: Handles engagement efforts between organizations, often times in the context of building business or governmental relationships.

Name: L3 Realty Services Risk Management and Governance
Documentation: Handles the management of policies and procedures in order to ensure compliance, including associated reporting and analytics.

Name: L3 Regulatory Affairs
Documentation: Manages oversight of an organization's compliance with regulations and laws pertaining to their business.

Name: L3 Regulatory Compliance
Documentation: Handles the adherence to laws, regulations, guidelines and specifications related to an organization's business, such as anti-money laundering and sanctions.

Name: L3 Sales and Operations
Documentation: Handles client relationship management and the processing of a product lifecycle from initiation of an application through funding.

Name: L3 Sales and Operations
Documentation: Handles client relationship management and the processing of a product lifecycle from initiation of an application through funding.

Name: L3 Sales and Operations
Documentation: Handles client relationship management and the processing of a product lifecycle from initiation of an application through funding.

Name: L3 Security Compliance
Documentation: Manages the efforts to ensure an organization is complying to the minimum security-related requirements.

Name: L3 Sourcing
Documentation: Handles finding the right suppliers that provide the quality needed at a price point that gives the margin needed.

Name: L3 Staffing
Documentation: Handles the process for finding the right employee with appropriate qualifications or experience and recruiting them to fill a position, role, or job.

Name: L3 Strategic Consulting
Documentation: Handles the analysis of business practices and goals to make suggestions for improvements or organization direction, including identifying trends within a specific market.

Name: L3 Strategy and Plan Development
Documentation: Handles the setting of business continuity priorities and the processes to support the direct implementation of what was planned.

Name: L3 Supply and Demand Management
Documentation: Manages the interaction between sellers of a resource and the buyers for that resource.

Name: L3 Support Services
Documentation: Handles the back-office support of a channel including call centers, mail centers, systems support, and process support.

Name: L3 Support Services
Documentation: Handles the back-office support of a channel including call centers, mail centers, systems support, and process support.

Name: L3 Support Services
Documentation: Handles the back-office support of a channel including call centers, mail centers, systems support, and process support.

Name: L3 Training
Documentation: Handles the teaching and development of skills and knowledge that relate to specific useful competencies.

Name: L3 Treasury Risk Management
Documentation: Handles the risks associated with the management of an organization's holdings, including liquidity, currency, interest, rates, and treasury operations.

Name: Account Manager
Documentation: An Account Manager is a person who is responsible for the management of a collection of customer or client relationships, typically focusing on customer and client acquisition and retention strategies.

Name: Auditor
Documentation: An Auditor is an individual who gathers, reviews, analyzes, and reports on the financial, legal, or other records of the organization.

Name: Authorized Representative
Documentation: An Authorized Representative is a person who has the authority to establish a new agreement and ensure it complies with company policy.

Name: Borrower
Documentation: An Individual or organization in debt to the bank.

Name: Broker
Documentation: A Broker is a individual or organization with a licence to  match a buyers and sellers without themselves being party to the transaction, for a fee or commision.

Name: Broker-Dealer
Documentation: A Broker-Dealer is a brokerage firm with a licence to as a market maker for securities. In other words, is allowed to keep risky financial positions in its own balance sheet awaiting to transact with its customers. The difference between a market maker and a broker dealer is that a broker dealer is not obliged to give its customers two-way prices.

Name: Business Analyst
Documentation: An individual eliciting, prioritizing, validating and communicating the organization's business need to interanal and exteral stakeholders.

Name: Central Clearing Counterpart
Documentation: An organization that steps into a bilateral derivative instrument transaction simultaniously as a buyer and a seller, assuming the default risk for both original parties.

Name: Channel Manager
Documentation: A Channel Manager is a person who manages the operations, including the production and supply of a channel of distribution.

Name: Clearing Counterpart
Documentation: An Individual or organization part to a clearing of financial instrument, including cleared derivative transaction agreement.

Name: Collateral Appraiser
Documentation: A Collateral Appraiser is a licensed or certified appraiser who provides a valuation for collateral used to secure a loan.

Name: Communications Consultant
Documentation: A Communications Consultant is a person who provides advice and participates in the development of communication plans and strategies, messaging, and associated media.

Name: Compliance Officer
Documentation: A compliance Officer is a person tasked with assuring the organisation that guidelines and policies are implmented and adhered too.

Name: Corporate Finance Specialist
Documentation: An individual who assist customers to raise financial resources through the issuance of financial instruments, either as a public offering or a private placement to targeted investors

Name: Credit Risk Analyst
Documentation: A Credit Risk Analyst is a person who evaluates the credit risks of a transaction and determines whether credit should be extended to the requesting party.

Name: Customer Service Advisor
Documentation: A Customer Service Advisor is a person who assists with resolving inquiries regarding an individual transaction in progress or an established agreement.

Name: Delivery Manager
Documentation: A Delivery Manager manages the development and launch of new products or services for a channel from idea to deployment, including post-deployment success.

Name: Financial Account Holder
Documentation: A Financial Account Holder is an individual or legal entity who has, plans to have, or had an agreement in place for a savings, checking, or related financial account.

Name: Financial Controller
Documentation: A Financial Controller is a person who is responsible for accounting activities and overseeing financial reporting, including balance sheets and revenue models.

Name: Financial Instrument Analyst
Documentation: A Financial Instrument Analyst is a person who evaluates a financial instrument for the purposes of packaging it for trading and delivery to investors.

Name: Financial Instrument Sales Advisor
Documentation: A Financial Instrument Sales Advisor is a person who uses the financial instrument evaluations to determine the packaging and trading terms with investors.

Name: Financial Planner
Documentation: A Financial Planner is a qualified investment professional who provides a service to help individuals and corporations meet their long-term financial objectives by analyzing the client’s status and setting a program to achieve that client’s goals.

Name: Investment Account Holder
Documentation: An Investor Account Holder is an individual or legal entity who has, plans to have, or had an agreement in place for a safekeeping of financial assets in a fidicuary account.

Name: Investment Management Company
Documentation: An organization regognized by regulation who's primary business is making investment decisions on behalf of their customers  with the objective to optimize the risk/return of an investment portfolio.

Name: Investment Manager
Documentation: An Investment Manager (also known as a Fund Manager or Portfolio Manager) is responsible for determining the strategy and investment portfolio as well as managing the assets to generate revenue and wealth for the organization.

Name: Investor
Documentation: An Investor is a person or organization that commits capital with the expectation of financial returns.

Name: IT Architect
Documentation: An IT architect is responsible for the design and evolution of the IT environment.

Name: IT Engineer
Documentation: An IT Engineer is responsible for the development and maintenance of all layers of systems within an organization, from the physical hardware to the operating systems, applications, databases, storage, and servers.

Name: IT Technology Lead
Documentation: An IT tech. lead is a subject matter expert in a particular area of the IT architecture. For example cyber security, or cloud technology.

Name: Legal Counsel
Documentation: A Legal Counsel is a person who is legally qualified and licensed to represent an organization in a legal matter, such as lawsuits, policy formations, contract negotiation, and patent activities.

Name: Legal Specialist
Documentation: An individual establishing, reviewing legal documentation, and provides legal opinion on a wide range of activities within the organisation.

Name: Lender
Documentation: An Individual or organization to which the bank is in debt.

Name: Market Maker
Documentation: A Market Maker is a broker-dealer firm with a license to assume the risk by stepping into the transaction as an intermediary. A market maker is obliged to provide the market with both a sell and buy price without knowning the counterpart's intention to either purchase or sell the instrument/risk.

Name: Marketing Manager
Documentation: A Marketing Manager is a manager whose primary task is to manage the marketing resources of a product or business.

Name: Operations Analyst
Documentation: An Operations Analyst is a person who helps in proposing  how to orginaze the daily actvities (workflow)  to fulfill the products and services of an organization.

Name: Operations Manager
Documentation: An Operations Manager is a person who decides how to organize daily activites and manage the daily operations delivering the products and services of an organization.

Name: Product Manager
Documentation: A Product Manager is a person who manages the development of products and services for an organization, performing activities such as market analysis, competitive analysis, maintaining product roadmaps, and managing product launch from ideation to development and deployment.

Name: Product Specialist
Documentation: A Product Specialist is a person who possesses deep knowledge of a product or product line and can determine appropriateness for individual customers.

Name: Program Manager
Documentation: A Program Manager is a person in charge of the planning and execution of a particular initiative.

Name: Public Records Administrator
Documentation: A Public Records Administrator maintains documents and information that is determined to be public information (e.g., property/land registry) and makes that accessible to the general public.

Name: Quality Assurance Analyst
Documentation: A Quality Assurance Analyst is responsible for applying the principles and practices of software quality assurance to thoroughly test software changes throughout the development life cycle.

Name: Regulatory Auditor
Documentation: A Regulatory Auditor is responsible for developing, implementing, and enforcing regulations that govern financial transactions, and market particpant behaivor.

Name: Risk Officer
Documentation: A Risk Officer is a person responsible for implementing,identifying, analyzing, and mitigating internal and external events that could threaten a company providing the first line of defence.

Name: Strategist
Documentation: A Strategist is responsible for evaluating both the internal and external environment and providing advice to an organization to help achieve their strategic business priorities.

Name: Trader
Documentation: A Trader is an individual  involved in initiating and managing financial positions by purchasing and selling financial assets. trading, market-making, and subsequent operations. A trader has the mandate to enter into financial agreeements on behalf of an organization.

Name: Trading Counterpart
Documentation: An individual or organization part to a trading for securities, cash and or derivative's agreement.

Name: Trading Venue
Documentation: An organized market place where buyers and sellers meet to establish a transparent and fair market price for financial instruments, including both securities and standardized derivatives.

Name: Trainer
Documentation: A Trainer is a person who acquires in-depth skills and knowledge in order to train an organization’s workers.

Name: Treausurer
Documentation: An individual with the responsibility to  optimize the use of the organizations financial assets and financial liabiliites. This includes making funding decisions and managing the timing of of cash in- and outflow as well as managing the risk and return

Name: Trust Bank (Custodian)
Documentation: A Trust Bank (Custodian) is a legal entity that acts as a fiduciary, agent, or trustee on behalf of a person or business entity for the purpose of administration, management, and the eventual transfer of assets to a beneficial party.
